fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JAC or take latest build of JIRA.
2. Invoke create issue dialog.
3. Select any project and/or issue type using up/down arrow key.
4. Press enter.

Result:
1. Nothing happens
2. Its only working in Safari.

Expected:
1. Pressing enter should open create issue form for the user.
fields.summary: Pressing enter is not submitting create issue popup in IE and FF

fields.description: I am in issue nav with a list of issues I'm going through (awaiting review) - when i choose a workflow transition from the tools drop down (set it to open) it does the correct transition BUT I would expect to stay on my existing list of issues (awaiting review) and that issue would disappear from my list.
fields.summary: Tools drop down actions - when doing a workflow transistion

fields.description:
If you click on the down arrow to open a drop down menu (top nav), then hover over other menus they will also fly out. I actually _prefer_ this behaviour for the JIRA top menu (flyout on hover), so it's not a drama for me. We should make it consistent (within JIRA) to not confuse people however.

(PS it might be worth having a Javascript component in JAC as distinct to a UI component? Not sure)
fields.summary: Drop down menus opens on hover after initial click

fields.description:
When creating custom screens offer a way to insert an HTML (or text) block that will appear on the screen.  Could be one of the options in the add field multiple select on the Configure Screen, and the position can be set just as the other fields.

Usage scenarios:
- insert basic instructions at the top of the screen
- links to user guides in a helpdesk project to keep issues down
- in the case of a helpdesk show the basic SLA, phone number or opening hours

I am sure this exists somewhere as there is a "please note" block on the create issue screen I am using to raise this issue, but could not find a duplicate issue, or could not find instructions how to do this.

Thanks
fields.summary: Allow for display HTML block to appear as an option on Configure Screen

fields.description:
Some issue navigator pages look totally broken, as if the CSS is missing. See screenshot.

When I log in to jira.atlassian.com, I have a portlet "Projects". If I click on the red or green issues bar, I get a broken page. If I click on any other linke, for example "resolved recently", the issue navigator link is ok.

URLs:

http://jira.atlassian.com/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&pid=10240&priority=3&resolution=-1 (broken)

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&pid=10240&status=5&status=6&updated:previous=-1w&sorter/field=updated&sorter/order=DESC (ok)

Maybe the extra http://jira.atlassian.com/jira/ URL part is the culprit.
fields.summary: some issue navigator pages severely broken (missing CSS?)

fields.description:
If the cloned issue was previously resolved, then the original resolution date stays with the ticket. The issue is in an open status and can go through the normal workflow, but the resolution date from the original ticket is preserved. 

It seems that cloning the ticket should trigger a clearing of the resolution date field.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Add " Average Age  gadget" or any gadget where user has to select filter.
3. Type any character for which you have project/ filter.
4. The application displays a list of filter/project to select.
5. Try selecting the project/filter using down arrow key.

Result:
1. User can't select project/filter.
2. Nothing happens on pressing down arrow key

Expected:
1. User should be able to select project/filter using up/down keys
fields.summary: Autocomplete keyboard navigation does not work in Internet Explorer

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA
2. Add "Average Age Chart" gadget or any gadget where "Days Previously" field is there.
3. Type 1000000000

Result:
1. It take the number of days without any error.
2. Add another 0 to the above number, it give user error message "Days must be number".

Expected:
1. Proper error message should be displayed.
fields.summary: Limit of "Days Previously" field is not defined in gadget.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Restore JIRA using the attached xml.
2. The default language is Spanish.

Result:
1. The header options and drop down menu options are not translated to the selected language.
2. When restore the same data in 3.13.5, its working fine.

Expected:
1. Header options should be translated to the default language.
fields.summary: Restoring xml data having default language as spain is not translating JIRA header options for user

We've submitted all i18n files for JIRA 4 and bundled plugins to translators. Once they've been translated, they'll have to be included in bundled plugins and we'll need an new release of the plugin with the files added.

See http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-18712

ensure gadgets work properly in igoogle

fields.description:
As gadgets exist in iframes, they are cropped when the dropdown's height is greater than the available height in the iframe. 

An easy solution to this is to expand the iframes height to allow for the dropdown. The problem with this solution is that it causes the gadgets below to move down to make room. This is not the general experience you associate with dropdowns. 

Also, dropdowns do not hide when clicking outside of the iframe. Vice versa, dropdowns do not hide when opened in the parent window and clicking in the iframe.
fields.summary: Dropdown are cropped within gadgets

The new "turn off autocomplete" link doesn't seem to be visible in IE.

Also, in the Admin interface, "auto-complete" is hyphenated, so for consistency it probably should be here too.

fields.description:
E.g. When I browse the "Documentation" component, there are links to versions 3.13.x, 4.0 and 4.0.1:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA/component/10120

When I click the "4.0" link, it takes me to all issues for that version, not just Documentation issues, i.e.:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA/fixforversion/14091
fields.summary: when browsing a component, should the linked versions only contain issues in that component?

fields.description:
There's nothing to indicate where comments stop in the new comments UI, which makes them look a bit naked on the bottom!

It's the same for other panels, like the Source panel when there are no commits. See attached screenshots. Feel free to close as Won't Fix if this is something that's intentionally designed to look weird. :)
fields.summary: Issue tab panels (e.g. comments, source) look naked without borders

fields.description:
This morning I logged into JAC and (after Dylan asked us to look out for it) explcitly set the remember me cookie.

I logged in at say 9.00am Sydney time

The at 11.19am Sydney time I went to view an issue and it asked me to log in.  It seems the cookie was lost in that time.

I did not close my browser in this time.  It expired behind the scenes it seems.
fields.summary: Remember me cookies has a touch of Alzheimers

fields.summary: OSGi Spring problem when restarting the plugin subsystem during an XML restore

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Search for issue based on created/resolved/updated date. Suppose I run a query like created date<= 2009/09/09(created before)

Result:
1. Issue created on the date will not return in the search result. 
2. Its working fine for created after.
3. It use to work in 3.13.5

Expected:
1. The search should work without any issue.
fields.summary: Search for date fields are not working as expected in particular scenario

fields.description:
in 3.13 and earlier, if JIRA came up without an index directory, the indexing subsystem was "disabled". When logic throughout the system asks if the indexing system is disabled (e.g. portlets/gadgets) they report this back to the user.

4.0b3 has lost this behaviour
fields.summary: Indexing system is not disabled when index directories appear to be missing on startup

fields.description:
Clicking "Full Content" in the following issue navigator gives a 400 response on JAC:
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&&jqlQuery=project+%3D+11771+AND+fixVersion+%3D+14790+ORDER+BY+assignee+ASC%2C+cf%5B10574%5D+ASC%2C+key+DESC

{noformat}
HTTP Status 400 - Not able to sort using field 'cf[10574]'.

type Status report

message Not able to sort using field 'cf[10574]'.

description The request sent by the client was syntactically incorrect (Not able to sort using field 'cf[10574]'.).

Apache Tomcat/5.5.26
{noformat}
fields.summary: 400 Bad Request when clicking "Full Content" in issue navigator
Tabs in issue tab panel look squished

fields.description:
Tried this one on j.a.c. I was attempting to link an issue I'd created with the two most recent issues I'd visited. The history drop-down seemed to want to display anything but those issues.

See the following screenshots for progressive results. The issues I'm after were CONF-16747 and CONF-16739. They were the two most recent items in my history, but I had to look up the number manually before I could narrow down the list to see all the ones I was looking for.

!Picture 3.png!

!Picture 4.png!

!Picture 5.png!
fields.summary: History drop-down in link creation does not show most recent histlry

fields.description:
Visit http://jira.atlassian.com/ or http://www.softwaretesting.de/jira-demo with Microsoft Internet Explorer 6. The box is way too small.

MSIE6 is (unfortunately) still widely used in large companies.
fields.summary: introduction box on dashboard broken for MSIE6

fields.description: You can see this in the Projects Gadget. Select a link from the Filters or Reports dropdown and it will open up inside the gadget rather than in the whole browser frame. See screenshot for example.
fields.summary: links from dropdowns in a gadget don't open in full browser frame, instead open just in gadget frame

fields.description: It'll take "minutes" but not "minute". Same for all other units. A new version of atlassian-core will need to be released since the parsing it in there. Justus is also making a change in core right now so coordinate a new release with him once this is fixed.
fields.summary: time tracking doesn't accept "minute", "hour", "day", or "week" as a unit

fields.description:
Due to editions we have 2 different pages that allow to view a Field Configuration:
# configurefieldlayout.jsp
# viewissuefields.jsp

As part of the fix to JRA-10427, configurefieldlayout.jsp was fixed but viewissuefields.jsp was not.

Due to this it is not possible to add Field Configuration specific descriptions to custom fields for the Default Field Configuration.
fields.summary: Change to allow descriptipons per field configuration did not take into account the Default Field Configuration

fields.description:
To reproduce:
# Go to JIRA > Administration > Global Settings > Time Tracking
# Deactivate if it is activated
# Set the Hours per day to 8
# Set Default unit to Days
# Reactivate
\\ \\
# Go to an editable issue
# Edit issue
# Enter 1 in the original estiate
# Click update
\\ \\

*Results:*
Original estimate is set to {color:red}24h{color}

*Expected results:*
Original estimate set to {color:blue}8h{color}
fields.summary: Default Time Tracking units do not respect the hours per day setting

2009-08-27 16:39:43,194 main ERROR     [atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl] Attachments are turned on, but attachment path [/Users/mdoar/junk/atlassian-jira-enterprise-4.0.0-Beta3-standalone/data/data/attachments] invalid - disabling attachments

I went to Admin, Attachments and selected enable and the default location and the directory data/data/attachments was created and attachments are enabled. Seems like that should have happened during configuration.
